instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.820-2375: What is 820-2375? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.CHGR_PHASE: What is CHGR_PHASE? CHGR_PHASE is charger voltage chopped up into individual slices prior to smoothing where it becomes PPBUS_G3H.

threads.title: macbook air no sound
threads.message:
hello
could i have some help to understand where is my mistake, anyway still don't know how the sound are generate in appleboard
this board macbook air "Core 2 Duo" 2.13 13" (Mid-09)
it been back to life with reflow but it's for me a nice training that's the point
the wire who connect the FaceTime camera was cut off and L9050 and <CAPACITOR>C9050</CAPACITOR> been damage did replace them, FaceTime working no sound or mic
i connect the mac on cinema display it has sound and mic then not GPU problem !
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> i have 7.46V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0_MIC_F</SIGNAL> is 3.3V sorry
I think it could be a transistor gate how to check it ? show me the way please
i have another board then i got all SMD needed !
please don't tell me it's a IC
thank you so much

threads.title: macbook air no sound
threads.message:
Post 820-xxxx of your board.
Need to know which schematic to use...
Bad audio connector is common failure for all MacBooks; as broken traces, or small resistors/coils on its area too.

threads.title: macbook air no sound
threads.message:
holla 
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2375</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A and i do use the schem MLB M96 PVT 09/26/2008 and <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2375</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>.brd
audio connector look good 
will test all the traces , i'm back to say if this it 
gracias por su ayuda

threads.title: macbook air no sound
threads.message: measure voltage on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> (<SIGNAL>PPVIN_S0_AUDIO</SIGNAL>) on the audio connector.

threads.title: macbook air no sound
threads.message: I was talking about headphones connector...

threads.title: macbook air no sound
threads.message:
hello
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> on the audio connector IS 7.49V not good (it should be 12.6V )
no sound at all ! by the macbook it self , but connected to cinema display every thing working true the mini display port

can't found this <SIGNAL>PPVIN_S0_AUDIO</SIGNAL> on schematic !

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> have 7.46V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0_MIC_F</SIGNAL> is 3.3V sorry young and confuse

( if i understand well it could be <CHIP>U7900</CHIP> IC ? <SIGNAL>CHGR_UGATE</SIGNAL> 7.51V / <SIGNAL>CHGR_LGATE</SIGNAL> 0V / <SIGNAL>CHGR_PHASE</SIGNAL> 7.48 )

really appreciate

threads.title: macbook air no sound
threads.message:
board was it liquid damaged? when you goto system preferences > sound > does it show any sound output?

have you try another audio board?

i think display port use MCP for sound and internal speaker use audio board for sound.

threads.title: macbook air no sound
threads.message:
not liquid damaged and no was all greyed ou no sound output or input Yes i did try another audio board and speaker 

ok working thank you it was faulty flex between mainboard and speaker

really appreciate your help anyway i learned see you soon !
